entities.description: Compulsion to smoke driven by nicotine craving and withdrawal.
Requirement of increasing amounts of nicotine to achieve the same effects.
Regular smoking habits and patterns over time.
Preferring smoking over other reinforcing activities.
Fixed patterns of smoking behavior.
Need to smoke to feel less restless and irritable after not smoking for a while.
Starting to crave cigarettes after a few hours of not smoking.
Feeling strong cravings for a cigarette controlled by a force.
Sense of control over smoking.
Worry about running out of cigarettes.
Increase in the amount of smoking since starting.
Need to smoke more for satisfaction compared to when first started.
Ability to smoke more now before feeling any effects compared to when first started.
Smoking fairly regularly throughout the day.
Smoking about the same amount on weekends as on weekdays.
Smoking about the same number of cigarettes from day to day.
Difficulty in saying how many cigarettes are smoked per day due to changes.
Smoking several cigarettes in an hour, then not another one for hours.
Tending to avoid places that don’t allow smoking.
Choosing not to be around friends who don’t smoke.
Avoiding traveling by airplane because smoking is not allowed.
Having friends who do not smoke.
Smoking behavior influenced by feelings or activities.
Smoking not affected by other things such as relaxation, work, happiness or sadness.

relationships.description: Smoking drive includes the need to smoke to feel less restless and irritable.
Smoking drive includes starting to crave cigarettes after a few hours.
Smoking drive includes feeling strong cravings controlled by a force.
Smoking drive includes sense of control over smoking.
Smoking drive includes worry about running out of cigarettes.
Nicotine tolerance includes increase in the amount of smoking since starting.
Nicotine tolerance includes needing more for satisfaction compared to when first started.
Nicotine tolerance includes ability to smoke more now before feeling effects compared to when first started.
Continuous smoking includes smoking fairly regularly throughout the day.
Continuous smoking includes smoking about the same amount on weekends as on weekdays.
Continuous smoking includes smoking about the same number of cigarettes from day to day.
Continuous smoking includes difficulty in saying how many cigarettes are smoked due to changes.
Continuous smoking includes smoking several cigarettes in an hour, then not another for hours.
Behavioral priority includes avoiding places that don’t allow smoking.
Behavioral priority includes choosing not to be around friends who don’t smoke.
Behavioral priority includes avoiding travel by airplane because smoking is not allowed.
Stereotypy includes having friends who do not smoke.
Stereotypy includes smoking behavior influenced by feelings or activities.
Stereotypy includes smoking not affected by other things such as relaxation, work, happiness or sadness.
